content_summary: The speaker discusses the ability to read and potentially modify cellular memory states, using the example of instructing cells to build an eye in an unconventional location on a tadpole. This is achieved by injecting RNA that encodes a specific ion channel protein, creating a voltage state that communicates the new instruction to surrounding cells.
